conclusion: Initial temperature at state A, \( T_A = -73^\circ C \) which is equivalent to \( 200 \, \text{K} \). Change in internal energy from A to C, \( \Delta U = 200 \, \text{J} \). Volume at state A, \( V_A = 1 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \). Volume at state C, \( V_C = 4 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \). Pressure at state A, \( p_A = 3 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \). Pressure at state C, \( p_C = 1 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \).
The ideal gas law is \( pV = nRT \).

premise: At state A: \( p_A V_A = nRT_A \)
At state C: \( p_C V_C = nRT_C \)
The internal energy change for an ideal gas is given by: \( \Delta U = nC_V \Delta T \). For a monatomic ideal gas, \( C_V = \frac{3}{2}R \). Given \( \Delta U = 200 \, \text{J} \):
